intro: Pervillaea venenata, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its striking violet to blue flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday. The plant has heart-shaped, hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens but can become invasive if not controlled.
